schema:name: Change in the annual proportion of marine bird species achieving relative breeding abundance targets, Greater North Sea and Celtic Seas, 1996 to 2019

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:author.schema:name: The Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic

schema:spatialCoverage: OSPAR marine regions (Greater North Sea and Celtic Seas)
schema:variableMeasured: Relative abundance of bird species, measured by comparing breeding abundance of each species against assessment values that are designed to reflect the resilience of different species to population decline
notes: Individual species-specific assessments are based on a 6-year rolling geometric mean of relative abundance which accounts for year-to-year variations in the data. Each datapoint refers to the final year of the 6-year moving average. Time series breeding marine birds used data from 1991 to 2017 for the Greater North Sea and from 1991 to 2019 for the Celtic Seas.

columns.name: year
columns.schema:description: The year range for the data present

columns.name: sea
columns.schema:description: The region or area of sea

columns.name: percentage
columns.schema:description: Relative abundance of bird species, measured by comparing breeding abundance of each species against assessment values that are designed to reflect the resilience of different species to population decline
